1: Research investment opportunities across 3 cities (Tokyo, London, New York). For each city: get the weather forecast, if it's mostly clear weather search for outdoor tourism news and analyze sentiment, if it's rainy/cloudy search for indoor entertainment industry news instead. Then get the stock price for a major company in each city (Toyota for Tokyo, Barclays for London, Goldman Sachs for New York). If the stock price is above $100, calculate what a $50,000 investment would be worth with a 5% gain, otherwise calculate with a 10% expected loss. Compare the sentiment scores across all cities, cluster the news articles by topic, compute statistics on all stock prices. If the average sentiment is positive, write a bullish investment report to investments_bullish.txt, otherwise write a cautious report to investments_caution.txt. Finally translate the report summary to Japanese and Spanish, and email the full analysis with all city comparisons to investor@portfolio.com
2: Build a global investment analysis for Tokyo, London, and New York. Check each city's weather: clear skies trigger outdoor tourism news research, bad weather triggers indoor entertainment news instead. Analyze sentiment for all gathered news. Get stock prices (Toyota/Tokyo, Barclays/London, Goldman Sachs/NYC). For stocks over $100, project $50k with 5% growth; under $100, project 10% decline. Cluster all news articles, compute price statistics, compare city sentiments. Write to investments_bullish.txt if overall sentiment positive, investments_caution.txt if negative. Translate summary to Japanese and Spanish, email complete analysis to investor@portfolio.com
3: Create a multi-city investment workflow covering Tokyo, London, New York. Per city: forecast weather, then branch - good weather means search outdoor tourism news, poor weather means search indoor entertainment news. Run sentiment analysis on collected news. Fetch stocks (Toyota, Barclays, Goldman Sachs). Apply conditional math: above $100 = calculate $50k + 5% gain, below = calculate $50k - 10% loss. Aggregate: cluster news by theme, compute stock statistics, rank cities by sentiment. Output to investments_bullish.txt or investments_caution.txt based on average mood. Translate report to Japanese and Spanish, email everything to investor@portfolio.com

Conditional calculations: stocks above $100 get 5% gain projection on $50k, stocks below get 10% loss projection. Cross-city analysis: cluster news topics, statistics on prices, sentiment comparison. Write bullish or cautious report depending on overall sentiment. Translate to Japanese and Spanish. Email full package to investor@portfolio.com
5: Execute a sophisticated investment research pipeline for Tokyo, London, and New York. Step 1: Weather forecast per city. Step 2: Branch based on weather - sunny/clear triggers outdoor tourism news search, rainy/cloudy triggers indoor entertainment news search. Step 3: Sentiment analysis on all news. Step 6: Cluster all news, compute stock statistics. Step 7: Write to investments_bullish.txt or investments_caution.txt based on sentiment average. Step 8: Translate to Japanese and Spanish. Step 9: Email everything to investor@portfolio.com
